page.title: 10EDUCATION
page.content: The schools in the area have been greatly affected by the nearness of the Warwickshire County Boundary. In Baginton village there was a primary school,next to the church.This school is now closed and the old school buildings are now the church hall.The schoolhouse is a private dwelling and the children of the village have to be bussed into Kenilworth for their educa tion.Three schools exist in Finham,the Comprehensive,Finham Junior and Finham Infants.These were all part of Warwick shire until 1965 when they became part of the Coventry system,although still geographically outside the city limit. In the Junior school hall there is a tapestry which commemorates this event It shows the links by including Warwick Castle and Coventry Cathedral. In 1986-7 the Junior and Infants will combine on the site of the former.
